line_1: After long Thought and grave Advice,
line_2: As Brentford Kings discrete and wise,

line_1: The heav'nly Influence of her sage Advice
line_2: Points from afar the dang'rous Rocks of Vice;

line_1: Opens his purse, and begs his best advice.
line_2: To a grave lawyer in a hurry flies,

line_1: Full fraught with our most learn'd advice,
line_2: In which we must be somewhat nice;

line_1: Tho' none more common, than to give advice:
line_2: No part of conduct asks for skill more nice,

line_1: I thank you, good Friend, for your good Advice,
line_2: I'll follow your Counsel, and strait in a trice

line_1: Hastes to his Ear, with safe, but lost Advice,
line_2: Tells him such Heights are levell'd in a trice,

line_1: Hastes to his Ear, with safe, but lost Advice,
line_2: Preferments treach'rous, and her Paths of Ice:

line_1: "But for you, if your Father will take my Advice,
line_2: "He'll send you no more, till he lowers his Price:

line_1: And loaded him with gifts and good advice;
line_2: Caparisons and gems of wond'rous price,

line_1: Vain is the Call, and useless the Advice:
line_2: To wise Perswasion Deaf, and human Cries,

line_1: Vain is the Call, and useless the Advice:
He damns his uncles if they give advice;
line_2: Loud in his wine, in women not o'er nice,

line_1: Produc'd his Play, and beg'd the Knight's Advice;
line_2: Our Author, happy in a Judge so nice,

line_1: They hoy't out Will, wi' sair advice;
line_2: It chanc'd the Stack he faddom't thrice,

line_1: The dishes then, by joint advice,
line_2: Some stammer'd on the toom ane thrice,

line_1: They gave, and She transferr'd the curs'd Advice,
line_2: That Monarchs should their inward Soul disguise,

line_1: They gave, and She transferr'd the curs'd Advice,
line_2: Dissemble, and command; be false, and wise;
